me.utk.networking

Interface ServerImplementation


  • public interface ServerImplementation
    The framework for any server implementation in this API.

    Any ServerImplementations must implement the following methods:

    • getAddress() returns a NetworkAddress corresponding to this server
    • getClients() returns a set of all clients connected to this server
    • enablePasscode() enables a randomly generated passcode to connect to this server
    • enablePasscode(int) )} enables a randomly generated passcode to connect to this server
    • enablePasscode(String) )} enables the specified passcode to connect to this server
    • disablePasscode() disables any passcode to connect to this server
    • enableNewConnections() enables new connections to this server
    • disableNewConnections() disables new connections to this server
    • enableAllConnections() enables all connections to this server
    • disableAllConnections() disables all connections to this server
    • closeAllConnections() closes all currently open connections to this server
    • closeServer() completely shuts down this server
    Version:
    December 8, 2020
    Author:
    Utkarsh Priyam
    See Also:
    NetworkAddress

    • Method Detail

      • getAddress

        NetworkAddress getAddress()
        Returns the information necessary for connecting clients to this server.

        This method returns a NetworkAddress object which contains both the IP address and the port number corresponding to this ServerImplementation.

        Returns:
        This ServerImplementation's corresponding NetworkAddress
        See Also:
        NetworkAddress

      • getClients

        Set<ServerSideClient> getClients()
        Returns a set of ServerSideClients corresponding to all clients which have successfully connected and been verified by this server.

        The returned set is not guaranteed to dynamically update to reflect changes in server connections. While some implementations may provide this feature, the only way to ensure an up-to-date set is to call this method again. Additionally, changes to the returned set may not necessarily be reflected in this server.

        Returns:
        A set of ServerSideClients corresponding to this server's clients
        See Also:
        ServerSideClient

      • enablePasscode

        String enablePasscode()
        Enables a randomly generated alpha-numeric passcode with an implementation-specific default length.

        The passcode can be disabled using the disablePasscode() method.

        Returns:
        The new passcode
        See Also:
        enablePasscode(int), enablePasscode(String), disablePasscode()

      • enablePasscode

        String enablePasscode(int length)
        Enables a randomly generated alpha-numeric passcode with the specified length.

        The passcode can be disabled using the disablePasscode() method.

        Parameters:
        length - The length of the new passcode
        Returns:
        The new passcode
        See Also:
        enablePasscode(), enablePasscode(String), disablePasscode()

      • enablePasscode

        String enablePasscode(String code)
        Sets the given code as the new server passcode.

        The passcode can be disabled using the disablePasscode() method.

        Parameters:
        code - The new passcode for this server
        Returns:
        The new passcode
        See Also:
        enablePasscode(), enablePasscode(int), disablePasscode()

      • disablePasscode

        void disablePasscode()
        Disables this server passcode entirely.

        The server passcode can always be re-enabled using the enablePasscode(), enablePasscode(int), and enablePasscode(String) methods.

        See Also:
        enablePasscode(), enablePasscode(int), enablePasscode(String)

      • enableNewConnections

        void enableNewConnections()
        Permits new clients to attempt to connect to this server.

        If new connections are enabled, clients will be able to connect to this server. Otherwise, incoming connections will be rejected or ignored, depending on the specific implementation.

        On the other hand, pending connections, specifically relating to connections which have already been established but are waiting for passcode verification will still be accepted and verified.

        See Also:
        disableNewConnections()

      • disableNewConnections

        void disableNewConnections()
        Prohibits new clients to attempt to connect to this server.

        If new connections are enabled, clients will be able to connect to this server. Otherwise, incoming connections will be rejected or ignored, depending on the specific implementation.

        On the other hand, pending connections, specifically relating to connections which have already been established but are waiting for passcode verification will still be accepted and verified.

        See Also:
        enableNewConnections()

      • enableAllConnections

        void enableAllConnections()
        Permits all clients to connect to this server.

        If connections are enabled, new clients will be able to connect to this server. Otherwise, incoming connections will be rejected or ignored, depending on the specific implementation.

        Additionally, pending connections, specifically relating to connections which have already been established but are waiting for passcode verification will also be accepted and verified.

        See Also:
        disableAllConnections()

      • disableAllConnections

        void disableAllConnections()
        Prohibits all clients to connect to this server.

        If connections are enabled, new clients will be able to connect to this server. Otherwise, incoming connections will be rejected or ignored, depending on the specific implementation.

        Additionally, pending connections, specifically relating to connections which have already been established but are waiting for passcode verification will also be accepted and verified.

        See Also:
        enableAllConnections()

      • closeAllConnections

        void closeAllConnections()
        Closes all currently active or open connections to this server.

        This method closes all connections, both ones which have been verified and ones which are pending passcode verification. All clients should be appropriately notified (according to the implementation-specific protocol) that the connection has been severed.

      • closeServer

        void closeServer()
        Closes all threads and resolves all objects in use by this server.

        This utility method provides a way of closing threads and resolving any objects in use by this server that could become orphaned when the server is closed.

        Any users should note that failing to call this method prior to destroying a server (via Java's Garbage Collection) can result in a build-up of inaccessible runaway threads which can consume processing power and even leave the Java Runtime Environment unable to close.
